As per Manchester United, Ronaldo broke the world record for scoring most goals in football history. Ronaldo surpassed late Austro-Czech footballer Josef Bican, who's estimated to have scored 805 goals by FIFA.

175.title: 12 missiles fired towards US consulate in Iraq from Iran: Officials
175.article_body: Twelve missiles were fired towards the US consulate in Iraq's northern city of Irbil on Sunday, Iraqi security officials said. A US defense official said missiles had been launched from neighbouring Iran. Another US official said there was no damage and no casualties at any US government facility, but Iraqi officials said several missiles had hit the US consulate.

176.title: People understood BJP should come to power if development is needed: Smriti Irani
176.article_body: After BJP’s victory in four of the five states where polls were held recently, Union Minister Smriti Irani said people understood that if they need development in the country, the BJP government should come to power. Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav’s EVM allegation, Irani said that EVMs were just an excuse.

177.title: You can't play negative shots or just keep defending: Iyer on 92(98) vs SL
177.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer, who smashed 10 fours and 4 sixes in his 92-run knock to help India post 252 in their first innings against Sri Lanka, has said batting with a defensive mindset doesn't help on turning wickets. "My plan...was to cut down the spin (negate turn), so I decided to step out [while batting]," he added.

178.title: 'The Kashmir Files' makers Vivek Agnihotri, Abhishek Agarwal meet PM Modi
178.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' team, including director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, actress Pallavi Joshi and producer Abhishek Agarwal, met PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. Abhishek took to Twitter to share some pictures from the meeting and wrote, "It was a pleasure to meet our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi. What makes it more special is his...noble words about #TheKashmirFiles...Thank you, Modi Ji."

179.title: 21-yr-old DU graduate found hanging in Delhi; probe on
179.article_body: A 21-year-old man who graduated from Delhi University's Hansraj College was found hanging from a ceiling fan in Delhi's Vijay Nagar. The body was found by his flatmate and locals. The police said they didn't find any suicide note and started a probe. The man reportedly hailed from UP and had recently landed a job in Noida.

180.title: Pune police file 3,500-page chargesheet in MHADA paper leak case
180.article_body: Pune police have filed a 3,500-page chargesheet against the director of a private firm and two agents in connection with the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) paper leak case. The three - Dr Pritesh Deshmukh, Ankush Harkal and Santosh Harkal - have been accused of seeking lakhs of rupees from candidates in a recruitment drive for 565 posts.

181.title: Chhattisgarh teacher comes to school drunk, beats students with bat; suspended
181.article_body: A school teacher in Chhattisgarh allegedly reached school drunk and beat the students with a cricket bat, according to the District Collector. Following the incident, the District Collector issued an order suspending the teacher with immediate effect. The incident took place on March 10, when the teacher arrived at the school after consuming liquor.

182.title: 20-yr-old Gr Noida man shoots sister dead for objecting to his drinking habits
182.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her 20-year-old brother at their residence in Greater Noida for objecting to his drinking habits. Police said the accused had come home intoxicated and had started puking when his sister scolded him. The accused, who had a pistol with him, started arguing with her and later escaped after shooting her dead.

183.title: Virat wants to enjoy his time at RCB as batsman, we respect that: Hesson
183.article_body: Talking about their decision to appoint Faf du Plessis as captain for the upcoming season, RCB's Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said it was clear that Virat Kohli wanted a break, which is why he stepped down as captain after last season. "Virat wants to enjoy his time as a batsman and we are very respectful of that," Hesson added.

184.title: Pune police arrest 2 cyber experts for misleading cryptocurrency probe
184.article_body: Pune police have arrested two cyber experts for allegedly misleading a probe into a cryptocurrency cheating case in which 17 people were arrested. The two, who were expected to assist police in the case, transferred seized cryptocurrency from national and international wallets to themselves and their partners, said police. One of them allegedly submitted manipulated screenshots to the police.

185.title: 2 assault watchman, steal ₹1.6 lakh-material from firm in Pune
185.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 68-year-old watchman with a sharp weapon and a brick and then stealing material worth about ₹1.6 lakh from a steel firm in Pune. A police official said that the duo had apparently scaled the main gate to enter the premises and later opened the gate to let their other accomplices in.

186.title: Bengaluru traffic police officer helps 80-yr-old man find his home
186.article_body: Bengaluru's Rajajinagar Traffic Police Station on Sunday tweeted that a traffic police officer, who was on duty in the area, had helped an 80-year-old man who'd gone missing from his house. It said that the police officer had tracked down the man's home and contacted his family by phone. The traffic police station also shared a picture of the incident.

187.title: Ukraine shares 'Spider-Man' meme to show damaged Russian tank
187.article_body: The official Twitter account of Ukraine shared a 'Spider-Man' meme to show a damaged Russian tank. Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed over 12,000 Russian soldiers, destroyed 362 Russian tanks and 1,205 armoured vehicles of other types amid the war. Russia had started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

188.title: Virat Kohli's gestures to Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' go viral
188.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli's gestures to the Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' during the second India-Sri Lanka Test have gone viral. Kohli was seen making a heart sign with his hands as the crowd chanted 'RCB RCB'. Kohli also pulled up his Team India shirt to reveal a red coloured apparel below it as the crowd chanted for RCB.

189.title: Mumbai psychologist held for selling brownies laced with hashish, opium denied bail
189.article_body: A special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) court has rejected a 24-year-old psychologist's bail plea, who was arrested with 10 kilograms of hashish-laden brownies. The accused was practising in a renowned hospital in south Mumbai. Mumbai's Narcotics Control Bureau unit claimed that the accused baked brownies with a mixture of hashish and opium and supplied them to several clients.

190.title: Satellite images show fires, damage to residential buildings in Ukraine
190.article_body: Satellite images showed damage to civilian infrastructure and residential buildings throughout the Ukrainian city of Mariupol. Maxar Technologies said fires were seen in the western section of the Black Sea port city and several high-rise buildings had been severely damaged. Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said Mariupol was besieged by Russian forces but was still under Ukrainian control.

191.title: Hailey Bieber hospitalised after suffering brain-related 'medical emergency'
191.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, the wife of singer Justin Bieber, was reportedly hospitalised with a brain condition that could possibly be linked to COVID-19. As per reports, Hailey, who has been discharged, was admitted after suffering a "medical emergency" that affected the way she moved. A report claimed that 25-year-old Hailey showed symptoms that were more typical of an older person.

192.title: 31-year-old woman blown up by Russian tank as she went to get medicine for sick mother
192.article_body: A 31-year-old Ukrainian woman named Valeriia Maksetska, who was leaving her Kyiv home to collect medicine for her sick mother, was reportedly blown up by a Russian tank. She was allegedly killed alongside her mother and driver in a village near Kyiv. USAID administrator Samantha Power tweeted that they were waiting in a car for a Russian convoy to pass.

193.title: French woman alleges sexual abuse by Kerala tattoo artist accused in 6 other cases
193.article_body: A French national has alleged that she was sexually abused by Sujeesh PS who was arrested after several female clients accused him of crimes including rape. The woman claimed she was abused by Sujeesh in 2019 during a trip to Kochi, police said. Six cases were registered against him after an 18-year-old opened up about being raped by him.

194.title: Couldn't be happier to pass on baton: Kohli on Du Plessis as new RCB captain
194.article_body: Reacting to Faf du Plessis' appointment as the new RCB captain, Virat Kohli said he couldn't be "happier" to pass on the baton to a "good friend". He added, "We've been in touch for many years now...absolutely excited for him to lead RCB and to play under him." Kohli had stepped down as RCB's captain after IPL 2021.

195.title: Ranveer Singh gets 'Number 1' jersey from football icon Ledley King, pic viral
195.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who is currently in the UK to attend the Premier League games, shared a picture with Tottenham legend Ledley King. Ledley gifted Ranveer a customised 'Number 1' jersey. The actor also opted to do the 'Dare Skywalk' at the stadium and shared that the "42 metre drop over the edge of the grand stadium" was "exhilarating".

196.title: Man throws son from 2nd floor after fire in US house; video shows police catching him
196.article_body: A man threw his three-year-old son from the second floor window of an apartment building on fire before jumping out to officers below. A video of the incident shows the police officers and firefighters catching the boy. "Pass the baby down...we got it," the officers could be heard saying in the video.

197.title: Punjab people's security more important than security of few: Mann
197.article_body: After an order was issued to withdraw security cover of 122 politicians including former MLAs and ministers, Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann said, "I think the security of the people of Punjab is more important than the security of few people." He added police stations are lying vacant. "We will take only police work from police force," the AAP leader said.

198.title: Ukraine bans export of fertilisers amid conflict with Russia
198.article_body: Ukraine, a major global producer of agricultural products, on Saturday banned the exports of fertilisers amid Russia's invasion of the country. The ban would help "to maintain balance in the domestic market" and applied to nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium and complex fertilisers, the country's Agriculture Ministry said. Earlier, Ukraine had banned exports of some agricultural commodities.

199.title: A brand new start for me in a new franchise: RCB captain Du Plessis
199.article_body: Newly-appointed RCB captain Faf du Plessis has said representing the franchise is a challenge for him as it's a brand new start for him in a new franchise. The 37-year-old, who until last year represented CSK, was picked by Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹7 crore at IPL mega auction last month. "So excited at [all] levels," Du Plessis added.

200.title: World's 5th richest person Buffett got $373,000 in compensation for 2021
200.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman and CEO Warren Buffett received $373,204 in compensation for 2021, including his salary and security cost, down from $380,328 a year ago. Buffett's 16.2% stake in Berkshire comprises most of his $117.9 billion net worth, making him the world's fifth richest person. Buffett has been receiving an annual salary of $100,000 for more than four decades now.

201.title: Man shot dead after injuring 3 French police officers in knife attack
201.article_body: A French man was shot dead by the police in France's Marseille after he attacked them with a knife on Saturday, leaving three police officers injured, authorities said. French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said that the attacker was not known to the police and had no police record. The motive for the attack was not immediately known.

202.title: Want to create digital blockade: Ukraine Vice PM as he asks firms to pull out of Russia
202.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov, who has been urging tech companies to pull out of Russia, said his goal is to create a "digital blockade" so that Russians question the war. The 31-year-old minister in an interview revealed that he has been worried about his father, who has been in intensive care after a missile struck the house next door.

203.title: 15 fire tenders mobilised as massive fire breaks out at Kolkata tannery
203.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Kolkata's Tangra on Saturday and 15 fire tenders reached the spot to douse the flames. Two fire brigade personnel were injured during the firefighting operations and were rushed to the hospital. Although the situation is under control, the extent of damage isn't known yet, an official said.

204.title: K'taka man attacks wife for filing divorce after learning about 1st wife
204.article_body: A man in Karnataka, Mohammad Ejaz Shiroor, has been arrested for allegedly attacking his wife Apoorva Puranik alias Arfa Bhanu on Thursday in Gadag district after she sought divorce. The victim, who changed her name after the wedding, had learnt about a year ago that Ejaz was already married and had three kids. The divorce matter was listed for Friday.

205.title: Baldwin tried to reach settlement to finish filming 'Rust': Report
205.article_body: Actor-producer Alec Baldwin had tried to reach a settlement to finish the filming of 'Rust' after a shooting incident which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins. Alec has submitted a filing which states that the cast and crew did not want to return to New Mexico. It further states that Baldwin convinced them to finish filming to honour Halyna's talent and legacy.

206.title: Central Railway earns ₹2.48 cr in 2021-2022 from film shootings
206.article_body: In the 2021-22 financial year, Central Railway earned over ₹2.48 crore by offering its premises and coaches for film shootings. It's the highest-ever revenue for any financial year, with Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) being the most prefered location. Different locations of Central Railway witnessed the shooting of ten films, two web series and a short film during the year.

207.title: Not a surprise to me: ABD on Faf du Plessis being named RCB captain
207.article_body: After RCB named Faf du Plessis as their captain ahead of IPL 2022, ex-South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers said, "The announcement comes as no surprise to me after RCB picked up Faf at...[mega] auction." He added that Du Plessis is an "amazing leader and the perfect man" for the job. "He has a fantastic tactical mind," he further said.

208.title: Moscow-Kyiv crisis talks have continued via video link: Kremlin
208.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Saturday said crisis talks between Moscow and Kyiv have continued via video link after in-person talks held in Belarus, reported RIA news agency. Peskov added Russian President Vladimir Putin briefed French President Emmanuel Macron, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on the negotiations held recently. Meanwhile, UN said 579 civilians were killed in Ukraine so far.

209.title: Paytm Payments Bank issues statement after RBI bars it from taking new customers
209.article_body: A day after RBI directed Paytm Payments Bank to stop onboarding new customers with immediate effect, the company issued a statement saying they are taking immediate steps to comply with RBI directions. It added, "We shall notify when we recommence the opening of new accounts after obtaining RBI approval." It also said the accounts of existing customers are fully functional.

210.title: 579 civilians including 42 children killed in Ukraine so far: UN
210.article_body: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Saturday said 579 civilians, including 42 children, were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24. The office added over 1,000 others were injured so far. As per OHCHR, most civilians were killed due to use of explosive weapons such as heavy artillery shelling and missile strikes.

211.title: India lose 1-2 vs Germany in shootout at Women's Pro Hockey League
211.article_body: India lost 1-2 to Germany in a shootout after both the teams were tied at 1-1 at the end of 60-minute regulation time in first match of double-leg FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Bhubaneswar on Saturday. Navneet Kaur, who scored the goal for India in the fourth minute, hit the only goal for her side in the shootout.

212.title: People are behaving as if I have no other work: Archana on memes on her & Sidhu
212.article_body: Archana Puran Singh, speaking about memes after Navjot Singh Sidhu lost in Punjab Assembly elections, told ETimes, "When there's something new happening to Sidhu, memes are made on me. Isn't that strange?" "People...are behaving as if I only have this job...and no other work...If...Sidhu decides to come back [on The Kapil Sharma Show] I'm willing to move on," she added.

213.title: 16 wickets fall on Day 1 of Day-Night Test, Sri Lanka trail India by 166 runs
213.article_body: As many as 16 wickets fell on the Day 1 of Day-Night Test between India and Sri Lanka in Bengaluru as Sri Lanka ended the day at 86/6, trailing India by 166 runs. Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets, while Mohammad Shami picked two. Earlier in the day, India were dismissed for 252 in first innings with Shreyas Iyer scoring 92(98).

214.title: Reduction in EPFO interest rate BJP's return gift after poll win: Cong
214.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said the reduction in Employees' Provident Fund Organisation interest rate was a "return gift" of the BJP to people after it won Assembly elections in four states. "Is it right to attack...savings of crores of employees on...basis of electoral victory?" he asked. EPFO has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1%.

215.title: Earlier you were asked to compromise to bag roles: Ekta Jain
215.article_body: Actress Ekta Jain in an interview has stated that actresses were earlier asked to compromise to bag roles which had put her off. "The circumstances at that time were really tough for television actors," the actress added. Ekta further said that the industry has drastically transformed and now people are looking for talent and good artistes instead of stars.

216.title: Former Zambian President Rupiah Banda passes away at 85
216.article_body: Former Zambian President Rupiah Bwezani Banda passed away on Friday at his home in capital Lusaka at the age of 85 after a two-year battle with colon cancer. Banda's death was confirmed by his son, Andrew and Zambia's current President Hakainde Hichilema. "We appreciate his service to the nation," Hichilema said during a televised address to the nation.

217.title: RS to get 19 hrs of extra work time in upcoming Budget session
217.article_body: The Rajya Sabha will get 19 hours of additional time for business over the earlier schedule in the second part of the Budget session that is set to begin from March 14. The House will sit from 11 am till 6 pm, with a one-hour lunch break. The first part of the Budget session had concluded on February 11.

218.title: Azim Premji forgives person who filed 70 cases against him; SC praises him
218.article_body: The Supreme Court praised former Wipro Chairman Azim Hasham Premji after he agreed to forgive the person who through his companies filed over 70 cases against Premji and his associates. "We're happy to note that Mr Azim Hasham Premji has taken a constructive view of the matter and agreed to forgive the past conduct of Mr Subramanian," the court said.

219.title: I apologise to Kashmiri Hindus for my indifference: The Kashmir Files' Prakash
219.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' actor Prakash Belawadi has posted a video apologising to the Kashmiri Pandits for his "indifference" to their mass exodus from the state. "I feel mortified, I also feel guilty as I was a journalist at that time and prided myself as someone equipped with...contemporary events, but I see it was not the case," the actor said.

220.title: Ukraine shares how it's spending crypto donations, says 'they're saving lives'
220.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Minister of Digital Transformation Alex Bornyakov tweeted, "Each and every helmet and vest bought via crypto donations is currently saving Ukrainian soldiers' lives." He said the funds are being used to buy bulletproof vests, helmets, thermal imagers and optics, medicines, and packed lunches for Ukraine's armed forces. Ukraine has received nearly $100 million in crypto donations.

221.title: Saudi Arabia executes 81 people in 1 day in its biggest mass execution
221.article_body: Saudi Arabia on Saturday executed 81 people who were convicted of various terror offences. This marked the kingdom's largest-known mass execution in its modern history. Saturday's executions exceeded the total number of executions in Saudi Arabia in the whole of last year. Saudi state television described those executed as having "followed the footsteps of Satan" in carrying out the crimes.

222.title: Vietnam bans Sony's 'Uncharted' over disputed South China Sea map
222.article_body: Sony's action movie "Uncharted" has been banned in Vietnam over a scene featuring a disputed map of the South China Sea. The scene shows the U-shaped "nine-dash line" that is used by China to stake its claim to large parts of the sea. China's claim in the sea includes areas claimed by other countries in the region.

223.title: Turkmenistan President's son likely to win snap presidential election
223.article_body: Serdar Berdimuhamedov, son of Turkmenistan's President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov, is likely to win Saturday's snap presidential election. Currently, Deputy Prime Minister, 40-year-old Serdar has been facing token competition from eight other nominal candidates in the vote. In power since 2007, President Berdimuhamedov called the snap election last month paving way for a generation of new leaders.

224.title: US using bats and birds as biological weapons, claims Russia
224.article_body: Russia has accused the US and Ukraine at the UN security council of a plot to use migratory birds and bats to spread pathogens. Russia's UN ambassador, Vassily Nebenzia, said the birds, bats and insects would cross Ukraine's western border. The UN said it was "not aware of any biological weapons programmes" in Ukraine.

225.title: K'taka Cong leader resigns, says, 'Couldn't speak to Sonia or Rahul'
225.article_body: CM Ibrahim, former Union Minister and senior Congress leader from Karnataka, tendered his resignation to party's interim chief Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. He said despite being a senior leader, he couldn't speak to Sonia or former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi directly. He said Sonia assured him of changes within Congress in the last 12 years, but he didn't see them.

226.title: Meta cuts on-site perks including free laundry, valet service for employees
226.article_body: Meta Platforms, Facebook's parent company, has informed its employees about cutting down various on-site perks including free laundry, dry cleaning and valet service. The company also announced that it would delay the free dinner time from 6 pm to 6:30 pm. While Meta offered a remote work option, many employees are scheduled to return to the office on March 28.

227.title: Can't blame Kohli for the way he got out: Parthiv on India-SL 2nd Test
227.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's LBW dismissal on Day 1 of second Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Sri Lanka, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said the ex-captain can't be blamed for the way he got out. "Pitch is so bad that he could've done nothing about it...ball was spinning...kept a bit low," he added. Off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva took Kohli's wicket.

228.title: Guatemala receives first arrivals of Ukrainians fleeing war
228.article_body: Guatemala on Friday received first arrivals of Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion in their homeland. The eight Ukrainians were the first to arrive in the Central American country for humanitarian reasons, an immigration spokesperson said. The officials added another flight carrying more Ukrainians arrived hours later. Meanwhile, UN said over 2.6 million Ukrainians fled the country so far.

229.title: AAP to contest all 68 seats in Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections
229.article_body: After a win in Punjab, Aam Aadmi Party said it'll contest all 68 seats in the Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. AAP leader Satyendar Jain said that health and education systems are in a bad state in Himachal Pradesh, adding that AAP will form the government in the state. Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections are scheduled to be held in November.

230.title: Completely incorrect: Congress as report claims Rahul, Sonia and Priyanka will resign
230.article_body: Congress has dismissed a report claiming that Congress President Sonia Gandhi and leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will resign at Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday over performance in recent elections. Congress Spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said the report "based on unnamed sources is completely unfair, mischievous and incorrect".

231.title: UN is negotiating to create aid corridors in Ukraine: Official
231.article_body: The United Nations is negotiating with both sides in the conflict in Ukraine to create corridors to deliver aid, the UN's crisis coordinator for the European country said. As many as 12 million Ukrainians may need aid, the official added. The most pressing humanitarian needs are in Mariupol, a besieged city in eastern Ukraine, the official further said.

232.title: He could've funded it himself: Lawyer on Musk's 'taking Tesla private' tweet
232.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer told a US court the billionaire is rich enough that he could've funded Tesla's going-private transaction himself. He was referring to Musk's 2018 tweet claiming he was considering taking Tesla private and that he had secured the funding. The lawyer said, "None of Musk's deals have ever had a funding issue...[He has] great personal resources."

233.title: RCB unveil their new jersey with stylised lion, share pics
233.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) have unveiled their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The jersey includes a stylised lion at the back. RCB announced that they have simplified their jersey as compared to the previous kit. RCB will face Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

234.title: Agreed to maintain stability: India, China after 15th round of talks
234.article_body: After holding the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on Friday, India and China released a joint statement, claiming that both sides agreed to maintain stability on the ground in the western sector. "They agreed to maintain dialogue via military and diplomatic channels to reach a mutually acceptable resolution of the remaining issues at the earliest," the statement read.

235.title: 13 states/UTs record 'above normal' temperatures in last 24 hours; IMD releases list
235.article_body: The IMD has released the names of 13 states/UTs that recorded 'above normal' maximum temperatures in the last 24 hours. The regions include Gujarat, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Goa, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura. Moreover, heat wave conditions are likely in Saurashtra-Kutch, interior Odisha and west Rajasthan over the next few days.

236.title: 2 men crowdfund money to buy Caribbean island & start their own nation
236.article_body: Gareth Johnson and Marshall Mayer launched a crowdfunding campaign and raised £250,000 (₹2.5 crore) to purchase an uninhabited island in the Caribbean. They completed the purchase of Coffee Caye, a 1.2-acre island off the coast of Belize. The island, albeit not officially recognised as a nation, is named 'Principality of Islandia' and has its own national flag, anthem and government.

237.title: He used to ask for movie tickets: Bellamkonda Suresh on ₹85 lakh cheating case
237.article_body: Telugu producer Bellamkonda Suresh, responding to the ₹85 lakh cheating case against him, said VL Sravan Kumar is from his village and used to ask for movie tickets. Kumar alleged that Suresh and his son took money from him in 2018 to make a movie. "I've not taken a single penny from anyone...I will file a defamation case," Suresh said.

238.title: People of Russia not the enemy: Mila amid Russian invasion of Ukraine
238.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis, speaking about Russia's invasion of Ukraine, has said the people of Russia are not the enemy, adding that it's not being said enough in the press. She was born in Ukraine in 1983 and moved to USA in 1991. Mila added she felt like a part of her heart got ripped out after hearing about the attacks.

239.title: Didn't bowl as wanted, gave many short balls: Stafanie on WI's loss
239.article_body: West Indies captain Stafanie Taylor said her side didn't bowl the way they wanted to following their 155-run loss against India in Women's World Cup. "Gave away too many short balls...Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana batted really well. We just couldn't get back from that," she added. Chasing a 318-run target, West Indies were all-out for 162 in 40.3 overs.

240.title: S Korea logs record over 3.8 lakh new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
240.article_body: South Korean health authorities on Saturday said the country reported 3,83,665 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, logging its highest single-day tally since the pandemic began. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), Gyeonggi province reported 1,07,943 infections, whereas capital Seoul recorded 80,437 cases. KDCA added that 269 deaths were reported in the same period.

241.title: UK-based startup Space Forge aim to launch country's 1st satellite
241.article_body: UK-based startup Space Forge and Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit may launch Britain's first satellite over this summer. "We're thrilled to be making UK history with our first launch," said Space Forge CEO Joshua Western. The CEO added that this is the start of a great collaboration. Space Forge's microgravity satellite, ForgeStar will be launched aboard Virgin Orbit's LauncherOne rocket.

242.title: Caribbean coral reefs have been warming for at least 100 years: Study
242.article_body: US researchers stated Caribbean coral reefs have been warming for at least 100 years. The team analysed sea-surface temperatures and revealed that the reefs were warming since 1915. However, they added that in four out of eight sub-regions, warming may have started during second half of nineteenth century. The team studied 5,326 coral reefs across eight Caribbean regions.

243.title: Elon Musk keeps his word: Ukraine Vice PM after receiving 2nd shipment of Starlink
243.article_body: Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to thank Tesla CEO Elon Musk after receiving the second shipment of Starlink terminals. Fedorov tweeted, "Received the second shipment of Starlink stations! Elon Musk keeps his word! Thank you for supporting Ukraine and peace in the entire world!" SpaceX had delivered the first batch of Starlink to Ukraine earlier this month.

244.title: Germany, Qatar discuss bilateral cooperation in energy, investments
244.article_body: Jörg Kukies, State Secretary to German Chancellery on Saturday said the government discussed bilateral cooperation in energy and corporate investments with Qatar. Kukies added he held talks with Qatar's Deputy Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani on March 9. This comes as the German government has been working to lessen the country's reliance on Russian oil and gas.

245.title: Putin may pay the price with armed escort to grave or retirement: Ex-Russian Minister
245.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, former Russian Minister Andrei Kozyrev has said President Vladimir Putin might "pay the price with an armed escort either to the grave or to retirement". "With Putin, I very much expect there to be resistance growing...that will be resolved one way or another...I don't know which way but Russian history is full of unexpected outcomes," he added.

246.title: Look into the eyes of our defenders: Ukraine as it shares pics of people fighting Russia
246.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has shared a collage of people fighting against Russia amid the war. "Look into the eyes of our defenders," the post's caption read. "There is no fear in their eyes...God bless all of Ukraine," a comment read while another Twitter user wrote, "I see love, life and determination in their eyes. Ukraine will win."

247.title: Woman beheads husband & keeps head in family temple in Tripura, arrested
247.article_body: A 42-year-old woman allegedly beheaded her 50-year-old husband and kept the blood-soaked head in a plastic bag at the family's temple in Tripura's Khowai on Saturday, a police officer said. The couple's elder son said that his mother developed a psychological disorder and underwent treatment by a local occultist. She has been arrested, police said.

248.title: Ex-bank manager among 12 sent to jail in loan fraud case in Hyd
248.article_body: A special court for CBI cases in Hyderabad has sentenced 12 people, including a former bank manager, to jail for up to five years in a housing loan fraud case dating back to 2004. The ex-manager of a Central Bank of India branch was identified as the main accused. He was asked to pay a fine of ₹2.25 lakh.

249.title: What worked for us was our approach, attitude: Mithali on India's win vs WI
249.article_body: Praising India after they defeated West Indies by 155 runs in 2022 Women's World Cup, India skipper Mithali Raj said she couldn't have asked for a better effort from her side. "Everybody knew about the importance of this game...what worked for us was our approach and attitude," she added. India's 317/8 was their highest-ever total in a Women's World Cup.

250.title: Man cheated of ₹4.3 lakh in Mumbai by woman claiming to be doctor
250.article_body: A 33-year-old bank officer working in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹4.30 lakh by a woman, who befriended him on Facebook and claimed she was a London-based doctor. The accused made him believe that she needed money to clear customs and he paid money frequently. On realising that he was cheated, he approached Kalachowki Police and registered a complaint.

251.title: Bengaluru can't grow in an unplanned way: Karnataka CM Bommai
251.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said the state capital, Bengaluru, can't grow in an unplanned way. He took to Twitter and said, "We need to develop high class, smart and self-sufficient [Satellite Towns] with hi-tech communication systems, that offer ease of living, travelling and of doing business and intermediate specific cities [like] health cities and education cities etc."

252.title: Pakistan seeks joint probe into accidental missile fire by India
252.article_body: Pakistan on Saturday demanded a joint probe into the incident involving the accidental firing of an Indian missile into its territory. "Such a serious matter cannot be addressed with the simplistic explanation proffered by the Indian authorities," said Pakistan's foreign office. India had blamed a "technical malfunction" during routine maintenance for the missile fire.

253.title: Woman submits fake educational documents to get job in Pune; booked
253.article_body: A woman allegedly forged educational documents to secure a job with the Maharashtra Police in place of her husband after his death in Pune. The woman reportedly wanted to get a job in the Criminal Investigation Department of Maharashtra Police as her husband was a police sub-inspector in the fingerprint department of CID. She has now been booked by police.

254.title: Hyd Traffic Police's green channel helps transport of live organs
254.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police on Saturday created a green channel to facilitate the transport of live organs from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Shamshabad to KIMS Hospitals in Begumpet. The channel was created in coordination with Cyberabad Traffic Police. "We would like to thank...Hyderabad Traffic Police and Cyberabad Traffic Police for providing a green channel," KIMS Hospitals tweeted.

255.title: Pics from space show Ukrainian shopping centre before & after Russian invasion
255.article_body: Satellite pictures by Maxar Technologies show the destruction caused after Russian invasion of Ukraine. Before and after pictures show a shopping centre in Ukraine's Chernihiv completely damaged after Russian invasion. "This is the first time in my life when I have to excavate the graves to bury five coffins together," city's mayor Vladyslav Atroshenko said.

256.title: China allows COVID antigen self-test kits for 1st time as daily cases hit 2-yr high
256.article_body: China for the first time has permitted the use of COVID-19 antigen self-test kits for the general public. It has granted approval to five COVID-19 antigen kits made by local companies for this. On Friday, China reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily count in around two years.

257.title: 122 former MLAs, ministers lose security day after Mann meets Punjab DGP
257.article_body: A day after Bhagwant Mann, who is set to become Punjab CM, met state DGP VK Bhawra, the Additional Director General of Police (Security) issued an order to withdraw security cover of 122 politicians, including former ministers and MLAs. Nineteen security officers were withdrawn from Manpreet Singh Badal's cover. A Congress leader, Badal served as Punjab's Finance Minister.

258.title: IISc B'luru develops paper-based sensor to detect hydrogen peroxide
258.article_body: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru, have developed a simpler way, a paper-based sensor, for detecting even tiny volumes of hydrogen peroxide. The chemical is widely used in products like hand sanitiser as a disinfectant. The paper-based sensor can reportedly be used to check household and healthcare products' quality and for testing biological fluids like blood.

259.title: 2 arrested for hitting Delhi Police constable with beer bottle
259.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that it has arrested two people, who had allegedly hit a police constable with a beer bottle. The incident had taken place on Thursday, March 10, in the Sarai Rohilla area. The police constable had asked the accused to not play loud music inside a car. Subsequently, they hit him and fled.

260.title: Deepika Padukone criticised for saying she was 'made to feel like a person of colour'
260.article_body: Deepika Padukone's recent Instagram caption, wherein she wrote that she was "made to feel like a person of colour", has been criticised by some social media users. "What does she want to tell? That being called...a person of colour is an insult? And she's a white?" a Twitter user wrote. "The choice of words is so wrong," another comment read.

261.title: Being an MMA professional helps me empower other women: Ritu Phogat
261.article_body: India's mixed martial arts (MMA) fighter Ritu Phogat believes that her profession "helps her in empowering other women". Phogat, who has a 7-2 MMA career record, added, "This is my chance to inspire millions of young girls and women not just in India but across the globe." Phogat left wrestling and took up MMA by joining One Championship in 2019.

262.title: Virat Kohli's 'stunned' reaction after getting out goes viral
262.article_body: Virat Kohli's reaction after getting out for 23(48) against Sri Lanka on first day of Day-Night Test has gone viral. Kohli got LBW out on the bowling of off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva. The ball spun and stayed low and hit Kohli's pads. After the dismissal, Kohli appeared stunned and stared at the pitch before walking back to the pavilion.

263.title: At times, I was too scared to listen to myself: Elli AvrRam on a decade in India
263.article_body: Actress Elli AvrRam while talking about completing a decade in India said, "The only thing I would have done [differently] is, those few times where I was too scared to listen to my...heart." "Instead, I listened to others' opinions," she said, adding, "Maybe those experiences were needed for me to...learn, that your heart is your right way through life."

264.title: I am very excited for the season: DC's Sarfaraz ahead of IPL 2022
264.article_body: Batter Sarfaraz Khan, who was picked by Delhi Capitals for his base price of ₹20 lakh in IPL mega auction 2022, said he's very excited for upcoming IPL season. "It's because this is my first season for Delhi. I'll try to do well in whatever chances I get for the team," he stated. Sarfaraz has previously represented RCB and PBKS.

265.title: Scientists find new species of giant tortoise on Galapagos Islands
265.article_body: Ecuador's Galapagos National Park on Thursday said scientists found a new species of giant tortoise. The team compared DNA of tortoises that are currently living on Galapagos Islands with bones, shells collected from the species in 1906. They found nearly 8,000 tortoises, previously identified as Chelonoidis chathamensis matched a different lineage which may have belonged to an extinct species.

266.title: Will take in 2,500 Ukrainian refugees from Moldova: German minister
266.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Saturday said government will take in 2,500 Ukrainian refugees who had fled to Moldova amid Russia-Ukraine war. Baerbock added that a corridor would be set up through Romania to bring refugees to Germany, primarily by bus. Meanwhile, as per German Interior Ministry, nearly one lakh refugees have so far entered the country.

267.title: We had a long discussion about loss vs NZ before WI match: Mandhana
267.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana who scored 123(119) in the 2022 Women's World Cup match against West Indies, said the team had a "long discussion" about the previous defeat against New Zealand before the match. India Women beat West Indies by 155 runs having been defeated by 62 runs against New Zealand. Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109 runs off 107 balls.

268.title: Maha govt allocates ₹1,500 crore for Pune Ring Road project
268.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and Finance Minister Ajit Pawar on Friday said that the state government has allocated ₹1,500 crore for the acquisition of 1,900 hectares of land for the Pune Ring Road project. He claimed that the project will help divert heavy traffic from entering Pune city. Separately, Pawar announced that Nashik-Pune railway project has been approved by the Centre.

269.title: Needed actor with gravitas, dignity: Bhansali on Ajay in 'Gangubai...'
269.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, speaking about the character Rahim Lala in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said that he needed an actor who exudes a certain gravitas, dignity and strength. "Ajay has all of this. The minute he walks into the film, audiences are with him," Bhansali added. The filmmaker further called the actor a director's delight and a considerate co-star.

270.title: Casting on OTT not based on star power, but on talent: Sanjay Kapoor
270.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor while talking about the casting process said, "It has got nothing to do with star power, but whether you are capable of delivering good." "It feels...good when you sign something on OTT. You know you are not being cast because of a certain value...your talent is enough," the actor added.

271.title: Meezaan Jafri to play lead role in Milap Zaveri's next: Reports
271.article_body: Actor Meezaan Jafri will reportedly star in 'Satyameva Jayate' director Milap Zaveri's next film. "Meezan is really excited to team up with...Milap Zaveri and Nikhil Advani. He loved the script and he will be seen in a never-before-seen avatar," reported Bollywood Hungama quoting a source. He will be seen playing the lead role in the romantic comedy, reports added.

272.title: EU, Turkish diplomats discuss Ukraine at diplomacy forum in Turkey
272.article_body: High Representative of the EU for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Josep Borrell Fontelles and Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Saturday discussed the situation in Ukraine at Antalya Diplomacy Forum. This comes after top diplomats from Russia and Ukraine held their first high-level talks on March 10. Meanwhile, UN said it recorded 549 civilian deaths in Ukraine so far.

273.title: Video shows long car queues outside McDonald's in Russia as brand shuts stores
273.article_body: A video showing long queues outside a McDonald's outlet in Moscow has surfaced on social media. McDonald’s has temporarily closed its 847 stores in the country over the Ukraine war. As per the company, the closure will cost it about $50 million a month. Meanwhile, people were also seen selling McDonald's burgers for high prices in Russia online.

274.title: 'Free Guy' director Shawn Levy to helm Ryan Reynolds' 'Deadpool 3'
274.article_body: Canadian filmmaker Shawn Levy has been roped in to direct Ryan Reynolds' third 'Deadpool' movie. Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick, who penned the screenplays for the first two movies, are also returning for the third instalment. Shawn and Ryan worked together in 'Free Guy' and the recently released action-adventure movie 'The Adam Project'.

275.title: Saying 'no war' means wanting Ukraine to give up: Ukrainian tennis player
275.article_body: Reacting to messages calling for 'no war' by tennis players including Russian world number one Daniil Medvedev, Ukrainian tennis player Marta Kostyuk said such messages indicate a desire to see Ukraine giving up. "They are meaningless," added Kostyuk. "It hurts me every time I...see...these Russian players. Their only problem...is not being able to make money transfers," stated Kostyuk.

276.title: Accepting Abramovich despite close links to Putin is our fault: Klopp
276.article_body: Talking about Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said, "It is clear he is pretty close to Vladimir Putin. Everyone knew it but we accepted it. That's our fault." "One man is responsible for [Chelsea's crisis], Putin," added Klopp. Abramovich's assets have been frozen due to sanctions by the UK resulting in financial uncertainty for Chelsea.

277.title: Best time to retire, want to give my place to a youngster: Lakmal
277.article_body: Ahead of his farewell Test match against India on Saturday, Sri Lankan pacer Suranga Lakmal said, "Rather than sticking around... I thought of giving my place to someone younger." In an interview, he stated, "This is the best time to leave". Making his Test debut at Colombo in 2010, the 35-year-old pacer has taken 170 wickets in 69 Test matches.

278.title: Deforestation in Amazon rainforest hit record levels in Feb: Brazil
278.article_body: Brazil's National Institute of Space Research (INPE) on Friday said deforestation levels in Amazon rainforest hit record levels in the month of February. As per INPE, a total of 199 square kilometres were cleared, up 62% from February 2021. INPE added that destruction was three times higher in the first two months than in the same period last year.

279.title: Assailants shoot at Meerut Agriculture university dean, Deoband jail staff
279.article_body: In two separate incidents, unidentified assailants allegedly shot at the dean of Meerut Agriculture University, Prof Rajbeer Singh and three staffers of Deoband jail on Friday. While Singh was shot at in Meerut when he was returning home from the university, the jailer along with two other staffers were shot at when they were at his official residence in Deoband.

280.title: Cardi B shares glimpse of 6-month-old son, says 'That's all you all will get'
280.article_body: American rapper Cardi B has shared a glimpse of her 6-month-old son. She shared the picture after a user tweeted, "Our baby cousin got teeth coming in and we ain't seen him yet." Posting a zoomed-in picture of her son's eye, she wrote, "That's all y'all will get." Cardi B and rapper Offset welcomed their son in September 2021.

281.title: Lot of actors won't do 2 or 3-hero films, I don't get why: Akshay
281.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has stated that there are a lot of actors who won't do a two-hero or three-hero project, adding that he doesn't understand why. "I don't want to take names but...I scratch my head...Doesn't it happen in Hollywood all the time?" the actor added. Akshay further said that if such films work, it works well for everyone.

282.title: Don't know if I replaced anyone in 'The Ghost': Sonal Chauhan
282.article_body: Actress Sonal Chauhan while addressing rumours that she replaced Jacqueline Fernandez in 'The Ghost', said, "I don't know if I replaced anyone." "People explore various options and cast an actor, who suits the script," Sonal added. While talking about Jacqueline, the actress said, "Jacqueline is an achiever...I have great respect for her as an actress."

283.title: Gutted to turn down one of my best chances: Hales on missing IPL 2022
283.article_body: Reacting to his decision to withdraw from IPL 2022 due to bubble fatigue, England batter Alex Hales tweeted, "I am truly gutted to have to turn down one of the best opportunities of my career." "It wouldn't be fair on the team or myself if I wasn't able to perform to the level expected," added Hales in his tweet.

284.title: Secunderabad man loses ₹73 lakh in 2 weeks in cryptocurrency fraud
284.article_body: A Secunderabad-based man lost ₹73 lakh in two weeks in a cryptocurrency fraud, police said. He'd initially invested ₹30 lakh through a mobile application, which later showed that the amount had risen to ₹2.4 crore. He then came across cyber fraudsters who convinced him to invest more money to be eligible to withdraw the profit. Subsequently, he lost the money.

285.title: Harry, Meghan to skip Prince Philip's memorial service in UK: Reports
285.article_body: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will reportedly skip Prince Philip's memorial service to be held on March 29. This comes amid Prince Harry's ongoing legal battle with the UK government to have his security reinstated. The memorial, which will take place at the Westminster Abbey, will allow the public to pay their tributes to the former Duke of Edinburgh.

286.title: I never wanted to shift to Bombay: Manoj Bajpayee
286.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee, while speaking at the Jaipur Literature Festival, revealed that he never wanted to shift to Bombay. "I realised that at the most they can give me a villain's role but at the end, it was all about heroes and celebrating heroes," Manoj added. However, the actor said the pandemic has changed the dynamics of filmmaking.

287.title: JD(U) extends support to BJP in Manipur after winning 6 seats
287.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) on Saturday said it would support BJP in Manipur. "JD(U) would like to appeal to the BJP to honour the mandate reposed in the party," it said. Of the total 60 seats, BJP won 32, one more than the majority mark, while JD(U) won six seats. The six MLAs elected Khumukcham Joykisan Singh as their leader.

288.title: Interest rate on EPF deposits reduced to 8.1% for 2021-22, lowest in 44 years
288.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1% from 8.5% in 2020-21. This is the lowest since 1977-78, when the EPF interest rate was 8%. The decision was taken at the 230th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees Employees' Provident Fund.

289.title: Actress Pooja Banerjee, husband Sandeep Sejwal blessed with a baby girl
289.article_body: 'Kumkum Bhagya' actress Pooja Banerjee and her husband, swimmer Sandeep Sejwal, have been blessed with a baby girl. The couple welcomed their daughter on Saturday morning in Mumbai. Pooja's brother Neil Banerjee confirmed the news to ETimes, saying that their family is "extremely thrilled with this new addition". "Baby's father and daadi are by Pooja's side in hospital," he added.

290.title: At least 47 children killed, maimed in Yemen in two months: UNICEF
290.article_body: At least 47 children were reportedly "killed or maimed" in Yemen's civil war in January and February following a surge in violence, Philippe Duamelle, UNICEF Representative to Yemen said. "Since the conflict escalated in Yemen nearly seven years ago, the UN verified that over 10,200 children have been killed or injured. The actual number is likely much higher," Duamelle added.

291.title: Congress Working Committee to meet on Sunday over states' poll results
291.article_body: The Congress Working Committee (CWC) will meet on Sunday at 4 pm to discuss the results of state elections. The meeting will be held at the AICC office in Delhi. Congress failed to retain power in Punjab, won two out of 403 seats in UP, 11 out of 40 seats in Goa and five out of 60 seats in Manipur.

292.title: RBI lifts restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after a year
292.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has lifted restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after more than a year, the private lender said. These restrictions were imposed in December 2020, due to instances of outages in HDFC's internet banking services. In 2021, the RBI allowed HDFC Bank to issue new credit cards after imposing a ban for eight months.

293.title: Among my top 3 knocks: Smriti on her 123 against WI in Women's WC
293.article_body: India opener Smriti Mandhana, who scored 119-ball 123 against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, said this was among her top three knocks. "After the last game we really wanted to come back strong and considering the situation, I'd rate this knock a bit higher (among her five ODI tons)," she added. Smriti was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

294.title: Murray beats Taro Daniel at Indian Wells, registers his 700th career win
294.article_body: Andy Murray defeated Japan's Taro Daniel 1-6, 6-2, 6-4 in the first round of Indian Wells on Friday and registered his 700th career win. With this win, the Briton became the 18th player of the Open era to achieve the feat. "This was a target that I [had] set for myself... last year," Murray said in an on-court interview.

295.title: Talks to revive 2015 Iran nuclear deal paused, says European Union
295.article_body: The talks to revive the 2015 Iran nuclear deal have been paused due to external factors, the European Union (EU) announced on Friday. Negotiators have reached final stages of discussions to restore the deal. Reportedly, the pause is linked to Russia demanding guarantees that sanctions imposed on its economy following its invasion of Ukraine wouldn't affect its trade with Iran.

296.title: Man dies of cardiac arrest a day after undergoing hair transplant in Patna
296.article_body: A Bihar Military Police constable died of a cardiac arrest, a day after he underwent hair transplant in Patna, an official said. "He died due to complications arising from hair transplant treatment. It could be a case of improper treatment leading to reaction of medicines during hair transplant," a doctor said. He had complained of itchy skin soon after transplant.

297.title: Alliance Air flight with 55 passengers overshoots runway in MP, probe launched
297.article_body: An Alliance Air ATR-72 aircraft with 55 passengers on board overshot the runway by 10 metres in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Saturday. The flight had taken off from Delhi at 11.32 am and the airline said all passengers and crew are safe. "We regret the unfortunate incident and have initiated an investigation into the incident," said the airline.

298.title: He used to watch my films 14-15 times: Akshay remembers his late father
298.article_body: Akshay Kumar, during an appearance on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', remembered his late father Hari Om Bhatia and revealed that he used to watch his films "at least 14 to 15 times". "Sometimes, [he'd]...ask his friend, 'What's going on? Let's...watch a movie.' He'd himself buy...tickets...and while watching the film...he'd tap his friend's shoulder and say, 'That's my son'," Akshay added.

299.title: Gifting platform Ferns N Petals raises ₹200 crore from Lighthouse
299.article_body: Online gifting platform Ferns N Petals has raised ₹200 crore from Lighthouse from its Lighthouse India Fund III. Founded in 1994 with a single store in New Delhi, Ferns N Petals reportedly offers 40,000 products including cakes, plants, personalised gifts and experiential gifts, among other things. It also has on-ground operations in the UAE, Singapore and Qatar.

300.title: Faf du Plessis replaces Virat Kohli as RCB captain
300.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) today announced Faf du Plessis as their new captain. The 37-year-old replaces Virat Kohli, who was made RCB's permanent captain in 2013. Du Plessis was bought by RCB for ₹7 crore in the IPL mega auction. Du Plessis has played 100 matches in IPL for Chennai Super Kings and now defunct Rising Pune Supergiant.

301.title: Ukraine Vice PM asks Bill Gates, Microsoft 'to do more to stop war'
301.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has asked Microsoft, its Co-founder Bill Gates, CEO Satya Nadella and Azure "to do more to stop the war". "Thank you for the first steps for peace, but...you have to do more to stop the war," he tweeted. Earlier this month, Microsoft had suspended new sales of its products and services in Russia.

302.title: 22-yr-old man arrested for allegedly raping a 6-yr-old girl in Bareilly
302.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl in Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh. The police raided the accused's hideout on Saturday morning where he fired at the police but got injured in retaliatory firing, a police official said. The accused and the minor lived in the same locality, police said. The crime happened on Friday afternoon.

303.title: Biden nominates Indian-origin Shefali Razdan as US envoy to Netherlands
303.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-origin political activist Shefali Razdan Duggal as his envoy to the Netherlands, the White House announced. "Duggal has served as National Co-Chair of Women for Biden and as a Deputy National Finance Chair at the Democratic National Committee," it added. She is a former Presidential Appointee (President Barack Obama) to US Holocaust Memorial Council.

304.title: Govinda once told me 'You'll become a big heroine': Karisma Kapoor
304.article_body: Actress Karisma Kapoor has revealed that she once waited for actor Govinda backstage during his performance to give him a rose. "When Chi Chi (Govinda) ji met me, he asked, 'Aap heroine banna chahti hain (You want to become a heroine)?' I shyly said yes and he said, 'Aap bahut badi heroine banogi (You'll become a big heroine)'," Karisma said.

305.title: Woman's charred body recovered from Kolkata guest house gutted in fire
305.article_body: The body of a 63-year-old woman from Bangladesh was recovered from a guest house that was gutted in fire at the Free School Street area in Kolkata on Saturday, police said. The fire broke out around 4 am due to a short circuit. The woman, rescued in a charred state was rushed to a hospital but was declared brought dead.

306.title: SHE Teams conduct awareness programme at Hyderabad school
306.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police on Saturday conducted an awareness programme at Krishnaveni Talent School in Turkayamjal, Hyderabad. The programme sensitised children about cyber crimes, human trafficking, child marriages, child labour and community policing among other issues. A similar awareness programme was also organised at Jahangirnagar within the Vanasthalipuram Police Station limits.

307.title: Police catch penguin that escaped from zoo & wandered on street in Hungary
307.article_body: Officers of the Budapest Police headquarters and the civil guards in Hungary spotted a young penguin waddling on the streets, caught it and handed it over to the zoo that it had escaped from. Sharing pictures of the bird, the law enforcement agency jokingly said on Facebook that "it would have been a long walk to Antarctica" for the penguin.

308.title: Shaheen reminds me of Imran Khan, will lead Pakistan soon: Aaqib Javed
308.article_body: Discussing Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi, ex-Pakistan pacer and PSL franchise Lahore Qalandars' head coach Aaqib Javed said Shaheen reminds him of 1992 World Cup-winning captain Imran Khan, adding that he will lead Pakistan soon. Lahore Qalandars won PSL 2022 under Shaheen's captaincy to win their maiden PSL trophy. Babar Azam is currently Pakistan's captain across formats.

309.title: Scientists develop early screening tool to detect autism in 1-2 year olds
309.article_body: Australian scientists have developed a screening tool capable of detecting autism in one to two years old toddlers, which is three years earlier than current methods. They studied 13,500 children in five years and found their tool detected autism accurately in 83% of them. This helped in better verbal and overall cognition at school age in such children, researchers said.

310.title: Can we stop judging a woman based on her necklines: Samantha to trolls
310.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu responded to being trolled for her outfit at the Critics' Choice Awards. "Making...judgements about a person simply based on the clothes they wear is quite literally the easiest thing one can do," she wrote on Instagram Stories. "Now that we're in...2022- can we...stop judging a woman based on the hemlines & necklines she adorns?" Samantha added.

311.title: 16% of state budget kept for education: Himachal Minister
311.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Education Minister Govind Singh Thakur said that 16% of the state budget has been allocated for the education sector. Of the Himachal Pradesh's ₹51,365-crore 2022-23 budget, ₹8,412 crore has been earmarked for education, he added. "The state government, during the present academic year, will give smartphones instead of laptops to meritorious children," Thakur further said.

312.title: Man kills friend with hammer, hides his body in house in Ghaziabad; held
312.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 35-year-old friend after hitting on his head with a hammer and then hid his body inside his house in Ghaziabad, police said on Friday. According to police, the accused killed his friend in a fit of anger after they got into an argument. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused, who has confessed to the crime.

313.title: Several injured, vehicles gutted in fire after medical students attack shops in Bihar
313.article_body: Several persons, including three police personnel, were injured and four shops and three vehicles were gutted in fire after a group of medical students of Darbhanga Medical College in Bihar allegedly attacked medical shops in the neighbourhood. The incident took place following an argument between the medicos and a shop owner over some issue on Friday night, police said.

314.title: Elderly couple in Ukraine confront trespassing Russian soldiers, video viral
314.article_body: A video shared by the US Embassy Kyiv showed how an elderly couple stood up to armed Russian soldiers who had broken into their property in Ukraine. The clip showed one of the soldiers firing a shot in the air to scare them away, while they continued to shout at them and managed to get them out of their property.

315.title: Kim posts pics with Pete week after being declared legally single
315.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian shared a series of pictures with her boyfriend comedian Pete Davidson on social media, captioning the post, "Whose car are we gonna take?!" This comes a week after a court declared Kim legally single and she dropped the surname 'West' from her social media accounts. Kim and Kanye began dating in 2011 and separated in 2021.

316.title: 70% of Ukraine's Luhansk region now occupied by Russia: Governor
316.article_body: About 70% of Ukraine's Luhansk region is now occupied by the Russian military, Governor of Luhansk Oblast, Serhiy Haidai, said. "The situation is difficult, shelling is ongoing everywhere," he added. Haidai warned people to stay vigilant and not help the invading Russian forces. Haidai said there were no humanitarian corridors for people to safely leave the region in eastern Ukraine.

317.title: Victory margins were less than 5,000 votes in 49 seats in UP polls
317.article_body: The victory margin of 49 candidates was less than 5,000 votes in the recently-concluded Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls, the Election Commission's data showed. As per the data, 25 Samajwadi Party candidates and three RLD candidates lost the poll battle by less than 5,000 votes. From BJP's side, 18 candidates were defeated by less than 5,000 votes.

318.title: UK, EU parallelly probe Google & Meta's 2018 'Jedi Blue' ad deal
318.article_body: The EU and British authorities have launched parallel investigations into a 2018 online display advertising deal between Google and Meta. Both the firms have defended the 'Jedi Blue' deal which the EU said may thwart ad tech rivals and disadvantage publishers in online advertising. Google has been accused of illegally working with Meta to counter 'header bidding'.

319.title: Mumbai Police chief probed by CBI for 6 hrs over Anil Deshmukh case
319.article_body: CBI probed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey in connection with its investigation against former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, officials said. He was examined for nearly six hours over allegations that he tried to influence former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh to withdraw the complaint against Deshmukh while Bombay HC was hearing the case.

320.title: Over 7,000 evacuated from 4 Ukrainian cities on Friday: President
320.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that a total of 7,144 people were evacuated from the Ukrainian cities of Chernihiv, Energodar, Hostomel and Kozarovichi on Friday. Notably, this is in comparison to almost 40,000 people that left a number of cities through humanitarian corridors on Thursday. Zelenskyy accused Russia of refusing to allow people out of the besieged city of Mariupol.

321.title: Under pressure India brought their A game vs giant killers WI in WC: Jaffer
321.article_body: Congratulating India after their 155-run win against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Under pressure against the giant killers West Indies, Team India brought their A game. Well played." India were reduced to 78/3 after 14 overs. Centuries from Smriti Mandhana (123) and Harmanpreet Kaur (109) helped India set a 318-run target for West Indies.

322.title: Pakistan have a weak captain who cannot be aggressive: Danish Kaneria
322.article_body: Talking about Pakistan captain Babar Azam, ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said, "[Pakistan] have a weak captain who cannot be aggressive while leading." Kaneria added that Babar is confused about his team's strength which is why he couldn't guide the curator of the Rawalpindi pitch, used for the first Test against Australia. "[Pakistan were] on the backfoot...the entire Test," stated Kaneria.

323.title: 2 held as B'luru police raid cricket gamblers; ₹2.20 lakh seized
323.article_body: Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru police have conducted a raid on cricket betting gamblers and arrested two persons, who were allegedly involved in gambling, the police said on Saturday. The police added that it has also seized ₹2.20 lakh cash and two mobile phones. This comes as India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test is being held in Bengaluru.

324.title: MVA to hold 'people's civic general body' meet in Pimpri-Chinchwad
324.article_body: Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in Maharashtra, which includes NCP, Shiv Sena and Congress, will hold a 'people's civic general body' meet in Pimpri-Chinchwad on Saturday. MVA is doing so in a protest against BJP refusing to hold a special civic general body meet to discuss budget proposals. BJP "tampered with the draft budget prepared by...civic administration", an NCP spokesperson said.

325.title: 25-yr-old Mumbai man lures 6-yr-old girl with chocolate, rapes her; held
325.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly lured a six-year-old girl with chocolate, took her to his house and raped her in Mumbai. Police said the accused, who was the neighbour of the minor girl, sexually assaulted her multiple times over five days. The incident came to light when the girl complained of pain in her private parts. He has now been arrested.

326.title: Smriti decides to share Player of the Match award with Harmanpreet, interview goes viral
326.article_body: After being named Player of the Match against West Indies in Women's World Cup, centurion Smriti Mandhana decided to share award with fellow centurion Harmanpreet Kaur. Mandhana's interview went viral, wherein she said, "Scoring century and not being...Player of Match is something [a player] wouldn't want." She joked, "I'm sure ICC will...give...another trophy...I'm sure they have enough budget."

327.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi Tech files draft papers for ₹3,350 crore IPO
327.article_body: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal-led Navi Technologies has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,350 crore through an initial public offer (IPO), Moneycontrol reported. The offer will primarily consist of fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Sachin Bansal co-founded the financial services company with Ankit Agarwal after exiting Flipkart in 2018.

328.title: 22 injured as BJD MLA rams car into crowd in Odisha; leader assaulted
328.article_body: At least 22 people, including seven police personnel, were injured after Prasant Kumar Jagdev, Biju Janata Dal (BJD) MLA from Odisha's Chilika, allegedly rammed his car into a crowd in Khordha on Saturday. The crowd had gathered outside Banpur Block Development Office for block chairperson election. Jagdev, who was also injured after being assaulted following the incident, is undergoing treatment.

329.title: How does the 2022 Women's World Cup points table read as India jump to top position?
329.article_body: With their second-biggest victory in Women's World Cup history against West Indies, India jumped to the top position on the points table of the 2022 Women's World Cup. The top five teams on the table have four points each. India are on top on the basis of net run-rate. India have a run-rate of +1.333, followed by Australia's +1.061.

330.title: ₹85 lakh cheating case filed against producer Bellamkonda Suresh, son
330.article_body: Telugu producer Bellamkonda Suresh and his son actor Bellamkonda Sai Sreenivas have been booked by Hyderabad police for allegedly cheating a financier of ₹85 lakh. The financier VL Sravan Kumar has claimed that the duo took the money from him in installments in 2018 to make a movie. Kumar further alleged that he was promised credit as an assistant producer.

331.title: Terrific knocks: Tendulkar on Smriti (123), Harmanpreet (109) vs WI in WC
331.article_body: Calling Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur's knocks against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup "terrific", Sachin Tendulkar said the Indian batters made batting look effortless. Smriti scored 119-ball 123, while Harmanpreet hit 109 runs in 107 balls. Notably, the Indian duo's 184-run fourth-wicket partnership against West Indies is the highest for India in Women's World Cup history.

332.title: 19-yr-old jumps off 5th floor of residential society in Gurugram, dies
332.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died by suicide after jumping off the fifth floor of a residential society in Gurugram's Sector 102 on Friday, police said. "The victim's mother and grandmother said that he told them that he was going out to purchase a pen...a few minutes later, he jumped off the balcony on the fifth floor," police added.

333.title: Why is 'Wali', fighting for Ukraine, considered 1 of world's deadliest snipers?
333.article_body: A former Canadian forces' sniper reportedly reached Ukraine to fight Russian forces on March 4 and has killed several soldiers. The 40-year-old, nicknamed 'Wali', is regarded as one of the world's deadliest snipers due to a confirmed kill shot from more than three kilometres away. He had fired a McMillan TAC-50 rifle to shoot an Islamic State militant in Mosul.

334.title: Nepal PM thanks PM Modi for evacuating Nepali nationals from Ukraine
334.article_body: Nepal Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba on Saturday took to Twitter to thank Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the Indian government for the assistance in repatriating Nepali nationals from war-hit Ukraine under 'Operation Ganga'. The Nepal Prime Minister added that four Nepali nationals have arrived in the country from Ukraine via India.

335.title: Delhi CM declares ₹10 lakh aid for families of deceased in Gokulpuri fire
335.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced ₹10 lakh aid for families of adults who died in a fire in the Gokulpuri area. "Government will give...₹5 lakh to deceased children's families and ₹25,000 to those whose shanties were burnt," he declared. Saying he was saddened by the incident, he added, "Poor make their shelter after a lot of hard work."

336.title: Don't let violation of privacy turn you into bad person: Jacqueline
336.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has said that the violation of a person's privacy can turn them into a horrible and bitter person. The actress added that it's important not to get upset and turn into a bad person. Jacqueline was earlier questioned by the Enforcement Directorate about her alleged relationship with conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. Her selfies with him had gone viral.

337.title: Fadnavis asked to appear before Mumbai Police in phone tapping case
337.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has been asked to appear before the Mumbai Police in a phone tapping case and transfer of IPS officers. "As the Leader of Opposition, I have the privilege to not reveal where I got the information from...If an offence was falsely registered and if the city police want some help, I will respond," Fadnavis said.

338.title: To resolve complaints of martyrs' kin, ITBP gives out smartphones
338.article_body: In a first, the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) provided smartphones to the families of the martyrs of the force, as part of its grievance redressal system. Ritu Arora, the chairperson of the Himveer Wives Welfare Association (HWWA), said, "Any kinds of complaints can be sent from these smartphones to the digital platform of the grievance redressal mechanism."

339.title: He's Modi ji's son, not mine: Crying father as his son returns from Ukraine
339.article_body: A man named Sanjay Pandita from Srinagar praised the government after his son Dhruv returned from Ukraine's Sumy. A video of the man breaking down in tears surfaced online, wherein he said, "I want to say that it is Modi ji's son who has returned, not my son." "We had no hopes given the circumstances in Sumy," Pandita added.

340.title: This is wrong: Instagram head after Russia decides to block platform
340.article_body: With Russia deciding to ban Instagram over Meta easing its hate speech policy due to the Ukraine war, the head of Instagram called it "wrong". Adam Mosseri tweeted, "This decision will cut 80 million in Russia off from one another, and from the rest of the world as ~80% of people in Russia follow an Instagram account outside their country."

341.title: Mosque sheltering 80 adults and kids attacked by Russian forces in Ukraine
341.article_body: Ukraine's foreign ministry on Saturday said that Russian forces have attacked a mosque in the port city of Mariupol, where more than 80 adults and children, including Turkish citizens, have taken refuge. Ukraine has accused Russia of refusing to allow people out of Mariupol, while Russia blames Ukraine for the failure to evacuate people.

342.title: Man looking for tenant online cheated of ₹4.18 lakh by fraudster in Pune
342.article_body: A man, who was looking for a tenant online for his flat, was allegedly cheated of ₹4.18 lakh by a fraudster in Pune. The fraudster reportedly posed as an Armyman, expressed his desire to rent the flat and subsequently carried out the fraud. Following a complaint by the victim, police registered a case and started an investigation into the matter.

343.title: Mumbai citizens needn't visit police station for passport verification
343.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey tweeted on Saturday that citizens won't be required to visit police stations for passport verification. They will be called only in exceptional cases when the documents are incomplete, he said, adding that they must report if this norm isn't being followed. "Constable who comes to your house does all the work. He's competent," he added.

344.title: Bored Apes maker Yuga Labs acquires CryptoPunks NFT collection
344.article_body: Bored Ape Yacht Club maker Yuga Labs announced it has acquired the rights to the CryptoPunks and Meebits NFT collections from creator Larva Labs. Bored Apes and CryptoPunks are the two highest-value collections by market capitalisation and floor price, according to CoinGecko data. Yuga Labs signaled that they will be giving full commercial rights of the NFTs to individual holders.

345.title: Specially-abled people can also contribute to security sector: PM Modi
345.article_body: Stressing on the importance of technology in the security sector, PM Narendra Modi said that technology has now become a potential weapon in the security apparatus. "Only physical training is not enough to be in security forces," he added. He further said that now specially-abled people can also contribute to the security sector despite not being physically fit.

346.title: Ukraine war at turning point: Zelenskyy as Russian forces regroup near Kyiv
346.article_body: Ukraine war has "already reached a strategic turning point", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said as Russian forces appeared to regroup for a possible assault on Kyiv. "It's impossible to say how many days we still have [ahead of us] to free Ukrainian land. But we can say we will do it...We're already moving towards our goal, our victory," Zelenskyy added.

347.title: Pic shows 'Ghost of Kyiv', Ukraine says he's coming for 'soul of Russian villain'
347.article_body: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine shared a picture of a pilot on Facebook. The pilot is said to be 'Ghost of Kyiv', the Ukrainian pilot assumed to be a myth. "'Hello, Russian villain, I'm flying for your soul!' - the Ghost of Kyiv," the caption read. Reports claimed the pilot shot down at least ten Russian jets.

348.title: World's largest brewer stops sale of Budweiser in Russia, to forfeit JV profits
