348.article_body: Anheuser-Busch InBev has asked its partner in Russia, Anadolu Efes, to suspend the sale and production of Budweiser beer in the country. The world's largest brewer said it will also forfeit "all financial benefit from the joint venture operations". The announcement comes after Heineken NV and Carlsberg A/S said they would stop producing and selling their beers in Russia.

349.title: Don't want to play a mother to 40-year-olds anymore: Shefali Shah
349.article_body: Shefali Shah has said she doesn't want to play a mother to "25, 30, or 40-year-olds anymore". "I don't want to look younger than my age...[I've]...children who're 18 and 19, I'm comfortable playing a character like that," she added. The 48-year-old actress played Akshay Kumar's mother in 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' and Ranveer Singh's mother in 'Dil Dhadakne Do'.

350.title: BSP spokespersons will no longer participate in TV debates: Mayawati
350.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) president Mayawati tweeted on Saturday that all the spokespersons of her party will no longer participate in TV debates. "It's not a secret that during the UP elections, the media, under instructions from their bosses, adopted casteist and hateful attitude towards the Ambedkarite BSP movement," she added. BSP won one seat in the UP Assembly elections.

351.title: Special feeling: Mayank on playing a Test at his home ground in Bengaluru
351.article_body: India opener Mayank Agarwal said it's a "special feeling" to play a Test at home in Bengaluru ahead of India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium. "Not many actually have an opportunity to do so...it feels really nice to be part of the team," he added. Mayank, who was born in Bengaluru, represents Karnataka in the domestic level tournaments.

352.title: Man loses 'lifetime savings' as he cheated of ₹1 crore in Gurugram
352.article_body: A 64-year-old man reportedly lost his "lifetime savings" after being cheated of around ₹1.39 crore in an insurance fraud in Gurugram. Police said the fraudsters allured him, saying that ₹9 crore had got accumulated from the investments he'd made as premiums of life insurance policies. They asked him to pay taxes to receive the amount. Police are investigating the matter.

353.title: ₹250 cr allocated for Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj memorials in Pune
353.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and Finance Minister Ajit Pawar has announced that the state government will allocate ₹250 crore to build memorials dedicated to Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj in Vadhu Budruk and Tulapur in the Pune district. Separately, Pawar said that the 'Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Bravery Award' will be launched this year for residents of the state who have shown exemplary bravery.

354.title: Russia seeks more Indian investment in its oil and gas after US ban
354.article_body: Russia's Deputy PM Alexander Novak has said that Russia's oil and petroleum product exports to India have approached $1 billion and added, "We are interested in further attracting Indian investment to the Russian oil and gas sector." This comes days after US President Joe Biden announced ban on all imports of Russian oil and gas amid Russia-Ukraine war.

355.title: Russian tanks were entering Sumy as we were leaving, was like hell: Evacuated Indians
355.article_body: A Mumbai student, who was recently evacuated from Ukraine's Sumy amid war, said, "As we were moving out of Sumy...Russian tanks were entering the city." She said even though Russians said civilians won't be harmed, people were being killed. "We saw destruction all around...The ordinary people are suffering [in Ukraine]. It's like hell," said another student.

356.title: Millions living in polluted sacrifice zones across Earth, warns UN expert
356.article_body: Millions of people across the world are living in "sacrifice zones" suffering from strokes, cancers, respiratory problems and heart disease as a result of extreme pollution in the environment, UN expert, David Boyd warned. These sacrifice zones are places with devastating physical and mental health consequences and human rights violations created as a result of man-made climate crisis, he said.

357.title: 5-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians unveil their new jersey, share pics
357.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians today unveiled their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022, which will begin on March 26. "This is the best MI jersey so far," a fan commented. Earlier today, Delhi Capitals also unveiled their jersey for IPL 2022. Mumbai Indians will face Delhi Capitals in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

358.title: 'Baahubali' changed my life & lives of the people around me: Prabhas
358.article_body: Prabhas said the 'Baahubali' franchise changed his life and the lives of the people around him. "I'm not at all worried about people still calling or referring to Baahubali...If it's still happening even after 10 years, it won't bother me...I'm very proud of it," he added. "It's fine for any actor to be known for a particular film," said Prabhas.

359.title: It's wrong: Prateik on actors being asked to seek permission for intimate scenes
359.article_body: Prateik Babbar has reacted to the recent debate around whether an actor should seek permission from their spouse before working on an intimate scene. He said that maybe a couple can have a conversation about it, but seeking permission is "wrong". The discussion started with the release of 'Gehraiyaan' which featured Deepika Padukone's intimate scenes with Siddhant Chaturvedi.

360.title: Convincing: SRH on India's 155-run win vs West Indies in Women's WC
360.article_body: After India's 155-run win against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, SunRisers Hyderabad tweeted, "A convincing win for Team India." The tweet further read, "A strong batting performance coupled with a team-effort with the ball by...women in blue seals a crucial victory." Smriti Mandhana (123) and Harmanpreet Kaur (109) helped India post 317/8. Sneh Rana took 3 wickets.

361.title: Stop crying like Cong: Sisodia to BJP on delaying Delhi MCD polls
361.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday criticised the BJP for delaying the MCD elections and Union Minister Smriti Irani's claim that the national capital's government was withholding MCD funds, saying, "What is this joke?" "Stop crying like Congress...and making childish excuses to run away from...civic polls," he added. MCD doesn't have money as it "indulges in corruption", he alleged.

362.title: Amit Shah flags off Dandi Cycle Yatra in Guj on 92nd Dandi march anniversary
362.article_body: On the occasion of 92nd anniversary of Dandi March, Union Home Minister Amit Shah flagged off 'Dandi Cycle Yatra' on Saturday. Organised by Gujarat Vidyapeeth, the yatra will cover the journey from Kocharab Ashram in Ahmedabad to Dandi in seven days. "The students...will spend the night in seven villages and will have a dialogue on...methods of empowering...rural artisans," Shah tweeted.

363.title: Sunny Leone's work permit for a film cancelled by Bangladesh govt: Report
363.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone's work permit for her Indo-Bangladesh film 'Soldiers' has been cancelled by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting of Bangladesh, as per a report by ETimes. The reason behind this decision is still unknown. However, there are rumours that suggest that some Islamic groups have threatened to stage protests if Sunny Leone enters Bangladesh, reported ETimes.

364.title: Edited video of Paris being bombed, hit by airstrikes shared by Ukraine official
364.article_body: Oleksandr Merezhko, the Chair of the Foreign Affairs Committee in Ukraine, has shared an edited video showing Paris being bombed and hit by airstrikes. "We also thought that it could never happen," Merezhko captioned the video. "Just think if this were to happen in another European capital," the text on the video read, referring to Russian bombing in Kyiv.

365.title: Russia bans Instagram after Meta allows hate speech against Russians
365.article_body: Russia's communications and media regulator Roskomnadzor announced that Instagram will be blocked in the country as the platform is spreading "calls to commit violent acts against Russian citizens, including military personnel." Notably, Meta Platforms has permitted users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war on Facebook and Instagram.

366.title: BJP won due to Hindutva and polarisation: Ashok Gehlot on poll results
366.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that the BJP won in the Assembly polls because they spoke "cleverly" in the name of Hindutva, polarisation. "Everyone knows about the COVID situation in the country and UP. Still, the Opposition lagged behind as they (BJP) speak cleverly. It changed people's minds. I believe truth triumphs in the end," Gehlot added.

367.title: Maha govt announces new 23-km metro line for Pune at a cost of ₹8,313 crore
367.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a new metro line in Pune connecting Hinjewadi's Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park to Shivajinagar. The 23-kilometre corridor will be the city's third metro line undertaken by Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority. The project is estimated to cost ₹8,313 crore. The state government has allocated ₹1,500 crore for land acquisition for Pune Ring Road project.

368.title: Parliament to resume normal sittings from March 14 with COVID protocols
368.article_body: The Parliament will resume normal sittings for the second part of the Budget Session from March 14 in view of the declining COVID-19 cases. However, the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha will continue to follow the COVID protocols, as seen in the earlier parts of the Parliament sessions. House will sit from 11 am-6 pm during the scheduled 19 sittings.

369.title: Don't send your sons to war: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy to Russian mothers
369.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has appealed to "Russian mothers, especially mothers of conscripts" to "not send their children to war in a foreign country". "Check where your son is. And if you have the slightest suspicion that your son could be sent to war against Ukraine, act immediately" to prevent him from being killed or captured, Zelenskyy added.

370.title: Deutsche Bank shuts down business in Russia, a day after its refusal
370.article_body: Deutsche Bank has decided to suspend its operations in Russia over the Ukraine war, a day after it had refused to do so. Stating that there won't be any new business in Russia, Germany's largest bank said, "We're in the process of winding down our remaining business in Russia while we help our non-Russian multinational clients in reducing their operations."

371.title: Over 75% cybercrime cases reported since 2019 remain unsolved in K'taka
371.article_body: As many as 32,286 cybercrime cases have been reported in Karnataka since 2019. Out of this, only 7,835 cases (24%) have been solved by the police so far with over 75% of the cases still pending. Moreover, as per the state government data, convictions were made only in 70 cybercrime cases. The state has 46 cybercrime police stations.

372.title: PM Modi dedicates a building of Rashtriya Raksha University to nation
372.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday dedicated a building of Gandhinagar's Rashtriya Raksha University (RRU) to the nation. PM delivered the university's first convocation address. "It's imperative that police manpower be trained in a way that they're amicable with people," he said. "After independence, recruitment in law and order needed reforms. Unfortunately, we were left behind," PM added.

373.title: Bouncer assaults students' parents at Pune school; video surfaces
373.article_body: A video of a female bouncer purportedly assaulting the parents of students at a school in Pune, who had come there with complaints on fee hike, has surfaced online. According to reports, the school alleged that the parents were getting "unduly aggressive with their demands". One of the parents who was assaulted has reportedly lodged a complaint against the school.

374.title: India to bat first in Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, playing XIs announced
374.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against Sri Lanka in Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. Axar Patel, who had taken 11 wickets in the Day-Night Test against England last year, has replaced Jayant Yadav in the playing XI. It is India's fourth Day-Night Test. India have won two of their three Day-Night Tests so far.

375.title: Snake, cobra didn't let mongoose win: Swami Maurya on UP poll defeat
375.article_body: BJP turncoat Swami Prasad Maurya said, "Mongoose is always superior to a snake. It is a different matter that snake and cobra together did not let the mongoose win." Maurya had contested from UP's Fazilnagar constituency on a Samajwadi Party ticket after resigning from the BJP in January 2022. However, he lost to a BJP candidate by over 40,000 votes.

376.title: Pic of Buzz Aldrin moonwalk taken by Armstrong sells for ₹5.9 lakh
376.article_body: An original picture of former astronaut Buzz Aldrin's moonwalk during the first manned lunar landing was sold at an auction for around ₹5.9 lakh. A series of 74 privately-owned photographs from Apollo 8-17 missions sold for ₹1.3 crore in the US. Aldrin's picture was taken by late US astronaut Neil Armstrong, whose reflection could be seen on Aldrin's visor.

377.title: Mumbai woman finds husband involved in same-sex relationships, lodges complaint
377.article_body: A 29-year-old woman lodged a case of cheating against her husband after finding out that he was allegedly involved in same-sex relationships. The woman had sent her husband's old phone for examination at a forensic laboratory in Mumbai's BKC after noticing his distant and unusual behaviour during their honeymoon. The laboratory's report hinted that he was into same-sex relationships.

378.title: Samson is as special as Rohit, always been stunned by his batting: Ashwin
378.article_body: Discussing wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson, Ravichandran Ashwin termed Samson to be "equally special" as India captain Rohit Sharma, adding that he has "always" been "stunned" by how Samson bats. "Samson watches a lot of Tamil movies and is a big movie buff, so am I," stated Ashwin. Ashwin will play under Samson for Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2022.

379.title: Sanctions on Russia could cause ISS to crash: Roscosmos chief
379.article_body: Western sanctions against Russia over invasion of Ukraine could cause the International Space Station (ISS) to crash, the head of Russian space agency Roscosmos has said. Calling for the sanctions to be lifted, Dmitry Rogozin said they could disrupt the operation of Russian vessels servicing the ISS. The ISS could "fall down into sea or onto land", he added.

380.title: Crawley-Root's 193-run stand helps England take 153-run lead after Day 4
380.article_body: The unbeaten partnership of 193 runs between Zak Crawley (117*) and Joe Root (84*) has given England a second innings lead of 153 runs at stumps on Day 4 of the Antigua Test against the West Indies. After losing opener Alex Lees (6) early, Crawley and Root piled on the runs which took the visitors' second innings score to 217/1.

381.title: Can't describe Shoaib Akhtar in one word, he's a whole book: Shahid Afridi
381.article_body: Responding to a query about describing ex-Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Akhtar in one word, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said one word is not enough, adding that Akhtar is a "whole book" single-handedly. "I have seen many fast bowlers, but Akhtar's strength and his bravery has wrecked the batters over," added Afridi. "He has achieved great things for Pakistan," stated Afridi.

382.title: Being very late is dangerous: Rashid Latif on Kohli's 'weakness'
382.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif termed Virat Kohli chasing deliveries bowled outside off due to an open stance as his "weakness", adding that it is "dangerous" to be very late with his initial movement. "The opposition has worked on this weakness," stated Latif. "He has to lessen the number of dot balls. Kohli has to be more aggressive," said Latif.

383.title: Actress Sonam Kapoor's father-in-law's firm cheated of ₹27 crore
383.article_body: The Faridabad police has busted a gang of cybercriminals involved in cheating actress Sonam Kapoor's father-in-law's export-import firm of over ₹27 crore. Police said the cybercriminals had been duping the firm by misappropriating Rebate of State and Central Taxes and Levies licences, meant for his firm, on the basis of his forged Digital Signature Certificate and encashing them.

384.title: NMMT to ply only electric buses on weekends in Navi Mumbai
384.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) has decided to ply only electric buses on Saturday and Sunday in the city to reduce fuel consumption as well as to keep the city environment friendly. Currently, NMMT runs a total of 150 electric buses in the city. The zero fuel day will help in reducing the daily operation cost, an official said.

385.title: Squid Game's Anupam shares pics with Will Smith, Selena from SAG Awards
385.article_body: Actor Anupam Tripathi, who was seen in the South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', recently met Will Smith, Andrew Garfield and Selena Gomez at the SAG Awards 2022. He shared pictures of himself with the Hollywood celebrities on his Instagram handle. 'Squid Game' won the award for Outstanding Action Performance by a Stunt Ensemble in a Television Series.

386.title: Ukraine-Russia war to hurt poor nations importing grain: UN
386.article_body: The UN food agency warned that poor nations in Asia, northern Africa, and the Middle East that depend heavily on wheat imports risk suffering significant food insecurity because of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The war is poised to drive up already soaring food prices, the agency said. Ukraine and Russia account for one-third of global grain exports.

387.title: Hyd man attacks his wife after fight; woman's 2 brothers kill him, his relative
387.article_body: Two brothers have been arrested for allegedly killing their sister's husband and his relative in Hyderabad's Jeedimetla. The incident took place after the woman's husband allegedly attacked her after a fight and she informed her brothers. Based on initial investigation, both the accused were carrying knives and they started attacking their sister's husband after getting into an argument.

388.title: India defeat West Indies by 155 runs as Jhulan Goswami creates Women's World Cup history
388.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 155 runs in their third 2022 Women's World Cup match on Saturday. India put up a total of 317/8, their highest-ever total in a Women's World Cup match. The match witnessed pacer Jhulan Goswami become the highest wicket-taker in Women's World Cup history with 40 wickets. Goswami overtook late Australia spinner Lyn Fullston's 39-wicket tally.

389.title: Pramod Sawant submits resignation to Goa Guv, says will form new govt soon
389.article_body: BJP leader Pramod Sawant on Saturday tendered his resignation as Goa CM to Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai as his first tenure came to an end. BJP is going to form the new government soon, he said. "Governor gave me a letter to be caretaker CM until the process is complete," he added. "BJP will work on...principles of Antyodaya," Sawant stated.

390.title: Absence of proper road makes pregnant woman go to Chhattisgarh from J'khand
390.article_body: A pregnant woman from Jharkhand's Gumla was taken to neighbouring state Chhattisgarh as she was unable to access proper healthcare facilities due to the absence of proper roads. "We called up Jharkhand's helpline number for a pregnant woman but we were told that they won’t be able to help us in the absence of the road," a local said.

391.title: 14-yr-old boy riding a two-wheeler dies in a road accident in Pune
391.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, who was riding a two-wheeler on a public road in Mundhwa, Pune, died in an accident, police stated in FIR on Friday. The deceased lost control of the vehicle and rammed into a tree causing severe injuries to his head and face. Another boy, who was sitting as a pillion rider, also suffered injuries in the mishap.

392.title: How many Day-Night Tests have been played so far and which team has won the most?
392.article_body: A total of 18 Day-Night Test matches have been played so far, with each of the matches producing a result. Australia have played the most number of Day-Night Tests (ten) and have won each of the ten matches. India have played three Day-Night Tests so far, winning against England and Bangladesh, and losing to Australia.

393.title: CJI NV Ramana lays foundation stone for IAMC building in Hyderabad
393.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana, on Saturday, laid the foundation stone for the construction of a new building of the International Arbitration and Mediation Centre (IAMC) in Hyderabad. The centre is currently operating from a temporary campus at Nanakramguda. SC judges Justice L Nageswara Rao, Justice Hima Kohli and state minister KT Rama Rao also attended the ceremony.

394.title: Maximum temperature likely to touch 31°C today in Delhi: IMD
394.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi is forecasted to be around 31°C today, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. Over the next six days, the maximum temperature is likely to range from 32 to 35°C along with clear skies and strong winds in the capital. Notably, the minimum temperature could range from 16 to 18°C.

395.title: SC appoints former judge AK Sikri as Char Dham panel head
395.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday appointed former SC judge Justice AK Sikri as the head of the Char Dham panel overseeing widening of roads under the ₹12,000 crore project. The court discharged former Chairperson Professor Ravi Chopra after he "expressed the desire to be relinquished from the assignment". Chopra had claimed the road ministry was ignoring the committee's suggestions.

396.title: Turkish journalist jailed for over 2 yrs for insulting Prez Erdogan
396.article_body: Turkish journalist Sedef Kabas has been sentenced to two years and four months in prison for "insulting" President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. She'd been in pre-trial detention since late January for using the proverb "cattle in the palace" against Erdogan on a TV channel and social media. However, Kabas was released from prison on Friday pending an appeal against the verdict.

397.title: Jaffer shares TikToker Khaby's meme to troll Labuschagne over Pakistani daal-roti pic
397.article_body: Wasim Jaffer trolled Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne after he shared a picture of him having 'daal and roti' for lunch in Pakistan. Reacting to Labuschagne dipping roti in daal, Jaffer tweeted a meme of TikToker Khaby Lame, apparently suggesting he shouldn't be dipping roti in daal. Khaby is known for videos wherein he reacts to things that people make complicated.

398.title: Apple, Google sign open letter against 'anti-LGBTQ+ efforts' in Texas
398.article_body: Apple and Google have signed an open letter calling on Texas Governor to "abandon anti-LGBTQ+ efforts to write discrimination into law and policy". The letter ran as a full-page newspaper ad in the Dallas Morning News. "The recent attempt to criminalize a parent for helping their transgender child access medically necessary...healthcare...goes against...values of our companies," the letter reads.

399.title: 15-yr-old gang-raped by 5 men at a hotel in Assam's Guwahati
399.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was gang-raped by five men in Assam's Guwahati, police said on Friday. Two of the five accused sexually assaulted her on February 16, filmed the act and threatened to leak the clip, the minor's mother alleged. On February 19, they invited her to a hotel on pretext of deleting the video and gang-raped her with three others.

400.title: Cab driver threatened to drive vehicle off Mumbai bridge; I begged for life: Actor
400.article_body: A theatre actor has alleged that a Mumbai cab driver threatened to drive the vehicle off a bridge after he asked him to drop him off outside his house, as he was travelling with his sleeping child and had a lot of bags. Marathi actor Pramod Shinde said "We gave him whatever money we had and...begged for our life."
